title: How is Japan ahead of the United States in technology? - Quora

response.answer_text: The US is a third word country compared to Japan when it comes to technology, compare the Tokyo metro to NY subway!, everyone is connected to the internet 24/7, compare the JR system to Chicago rapid transit (basically a pile of rusted junk I’m ashamed to say), their cars are still far better built and last a lot longer than the crap turned out by Detroit, superior robotics, higher grade of silicon chips, the list goes on….. Quoting a famous american physicist: “If you think back to the early years after World War II, America was the dominant player almost right across the board in advanced industries. Now there is hardly an industry left where that can be said. Meanwhile Japan has continued to gain dominance in dozens of advanced industries.”

In some areas, Japan’s technology already DOES surpass America’s. Some examples off the top of my head. Earthquake prediction. Neutrino detection (the setup at Kamiokande is REALLY cool). Hybrid cars. Road tunnel technology (who else can build a tunnel that is twice as far as the Channel Tunnel, under a deeper strait AND in a severe earthquake zone?). Ultra-fast trains. Etc.

Depends on what kind of technology. With infrastructure and public transportation especially trains, Japanese technology is clearly superior. In areas such as computer and medical technology, the US is the winner. Both do certain things better.

Technology has no boundaries, and most technology is the result of multiple people and countries all over. Even within a specific country, the range and purpose of technology varies wildly. Also, “technology” is really too broad of a term to give an answer.
Neither. In both countries, technology is developed by companies (many of which operate in both countries). It should really be a comparison of technology between Companies.
America's technology is decades behind Japan so your question is the wrong way around and when it is the correct way round the answer will be no
